sentences.en: ...the potential to fire the imagination of an entire generation.
sentences.cn: …激发整整一代人的想像力的潜能。

sentences.en: "I want to clear up some questions which have been puzzling me." "Fire away.".
sentences.cn: "我想弄清一些一直让我困惑的问题。""问吧。"。

sentences.en: All I could hear was the sputter of the fire.
sentences.cn: 我只能听到火的毕剥声。

sentences.en: Don't leave a child alone in a room with an open fire.
sentences.cn: 房间里有裸露的明火时，不要让孩子独处其中。

sentences.en: Fire may have breached the cargo tanks and set the oil ablaze.
sentences.cn: 大火当时有可能把货船上的油罐烧漏了，从而引燃原油。

sentences.en: He has said he will fire editorial employees without regard to seniority.
sentences.cn: 他说过不管资历如何，任何编辑人员他都有可能解雇。

sentences.en: his father was preaching fire and brimstone sermons.
sentences.cn: 他父亲在作有关地狱磨难的说教。

sentences.en: I don't want an indignant boyfriend on my doorstep breathing fire.
sentences.cn: 我可不想要一位愤愤不平的男朋友在我门阶上大发脾气。

sentences.en: I'm sad about my toys getting burned in the fire.
sentences.cn: 我的玩具在这场火中付之一炬，这令我很难过。

sentences.en: In the evening a log fire would provide cosiness.
sentences.cn: 晚上点起篝火会让人感到温暖舒适。

sentences.en: It started a fire in a block of flats.
sentences.cn: 大火是从一幢公寓大楼烧起的。

sentences.en: Legs of pork were cured and smoked over the fire.
sentences.cn: 在火上熏制猪腿。

sentences.en: Once the fire has died out, the salvage team will move in.
sentences.cn: 一旦大火熄灭，救援小组就会马上进入。

sentences.en: Police think that the fire was started deliberately.
sentences.cn: 警方认为有人故意纵火。

sentences.en: Rioters set fire to a whole row of stores (= made them start burning ) .
sentences.cn: 暴徒纵火焚烧了一整排商店。

sentences.en: Shoppers took cover behind cars as police marksmen returned fire.
sentences.cn: 警方的射击手开火回击时，购物者们躲在汽车后面。

sentences.en: Soldiers fired on the crowd.
sentences.cn: 士兵朝人群开枪。

sentences.en: The captain radioed that the ship was on fire.
sentences.cn: 船长发无线电说船着火了。

sentences.en: The council recently drew fire for its intervention in the dispute.
sentences.cn: 委员会最近因为介入该起争端而遭到批评。

sentences.en: the film hasn't exactly set the world on fire.
sentences.cn: 这部影片并没有真正引起轰动。

sentences.en: The warehouse was completely destroyed by fire.
sentences.cn: 仓库全给烧毁了。

sentences.en: They're likely to hold big fire sales to liquidate their inventory.
sentences.cn: 他们可能会举行清仓大甩卖。

sentences.en: Thirty people died in a fire in downtown Chicago.
sentences.cn: 30人死于芝加哥市中心的一场火灾。

sentences.en: Two men riding on motorcycles opened fire on him.
sentences.cn: 两个骑摩托车的男人向他开了枪。

sentences.en: We sat round the fire to keep ourselves warm.
sentences.cn: 我们围坐在火边取暖。

sentences.en: When the team’s firing on all cylinders, they can beat the best in the league.
sentences.cn: 那支球队如果全力以赴，可以击败联赛中的最强者。

words.tran_cn: 开火；烧制；解雇（fire的ing形式）；点燃；激励
火；[安全]火灾；炮火；炉火；热情；激情；磨难
着火；[军]射击；开枪；激动；烧火

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)［用以表示许可］说吧，讲吧；问吧
开始：开始讲话或问问题
消防；火力控制；射击控制
火灾探测；火警探测；火警侦察器
抗火性，耐火性（能）；抗燃烧性
阻燃剂；防火剂；防火材料
森林火灾；森林大火；山火
(苏格兰，爱尔兰)开始燃烧；着火
adv. 着火；起火；在兴头上；非常激动
受到严厉批评；遭到攻击
(非正式)干吗这么慌张（或兴奋）

trans.tran_cn: 火（灾），炉火，取暖器，火力，激情
trans.tran_en: uncontrolled flames, light, and heat that destroy and damage things

trans.tran_cn: 射击，解雇，烧制，(引擎)点火，驱动，唤起
trans.tran_en: to force someone to leave their job
to force someone to leave their job
